com.adpetions.optimus

Class Transformer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adpetions.optimus.Transformer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the cargo that will be passed to registered EventHandler.handle() methods

    public class Transformer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The main Transformer transformer class

    • Constructor Summary

      T getCargo()
      Get the cargo that is to be passed to event handlers
      boolean getCoalescing()
      Get whether the XML reader is to coalesce (Coalescing ensures that text nodes are read with one event)
      EntityReferenceResolver getEntityReferenceResolver()
      Get the entity reference resolver
      boolean getForceNonSelfClosing()
      Get whether the transform is to force non-self closing elements
      TransformNamespaceContext getNamespaceContext()
      Get the namespace context
      boolean getOmitXmlDeclaration()
      Get whether the XML Declaration should be omitted at the start of the document
      boolean getPathMapCaching()
      Get whether path map caching is turned on When path map caching is turned on, the handlers for each node path are cached - the transform will be slightly faster but consume more memory
      boolean getSuppressWhitespace()
      Get whether the transform is to suppress whitespace
      boolean getTrackAttributes()
      Get whether the transform is tracking attributes

      Performs the transform with a null output output

      • transform

        public void transform(TransformXMLStreamWriter xmlWriter)
               throws TransformException,
                      javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Performs a nested transform outputting to the specified writer

        NB. Passing null as the writer argument means that Transformer will use a null writer (i.e. no output)

        Parameters:
        xmlWriter - the XML writer to be used for output
        Throws:
        TransformException
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException

      • registerHandler

        public Transformer registerHandler(EventType eventType,
                                   int priority,
                                   EventHandler<T> handler)
                            throws TransformException
        Registers a handler to be used during transform
        Parameters:
        eventType - the event type for which the handler is to be registered
        priority - the priority for the event (higher priority handlers are called first)
        handler - the handler to be registered
        Returns:
        the Transformer transformer (for chained calls)
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • getPathMapCaching

        public boolean getPathMapCaching()
        Get whether path map caching is turned on When path map caching is turned on, the handlers for each node path are cached - the transform will be slightly faster but consume more memory
        Returns:
        whether path map caching is turned on

      • setPathMapCaching

        public void setPathMapCaching(boolean pathMapCaching)
        Set whether path map caching is turned on When path map caching is turned on, the handlers for each node path are cached - the transform will be slightly faster but consume more memory
        Parameters:
        pathMapCaching - whether path map caching is turned on
